"Specialization," he repeats, as if tasting the word. "There is wisdom in it, Your Majesty. A knight who knows one task deeply fights better than one who knows many tasks poorly." He pauses. "But I confess some... concern."


Don Pedro leans forward. "Santiago fears being reduced to a colonization society," he says bluntly. Don Luis shoots him a sharp look, but the Calatrava Master continues. "And rightly so. We are Military Orders. Our purpose is to fight for Christ, not merely to shepherd farmers onto ships."

Don Luis nods reluctantly. "Santiago would say the same. We will settle Constantinople, patrol for pirates, garrison Granada—but we are warriors first. If there is battle to be had against the infidel, we must not be excluded."
